name: Roo.data.SimpleStore
desc: Small helper class to make creating Stores from Array data easier.

config.name: an
config.desc: existing reader (eg. copied from another store)

config.name: listeners
id
config.desc: The array index of the record id. Leave blank to auto generate ids.

config.name: fields
config.desc: An array of field definition objects, or field name strings.

config.name: multiSort
config.desc: enable multi column sorting (sort is based on the order of columns, remote only at present)

config.name: pruneModifiedRecords
config.desc:
True to clear all modified record information each time the store is
loaded or when a record is removed. (defaults to false).

config.name: remoteSort
config.desc:
True if sorting is to be handled by requesting the Proxy to provide a refreshed
version of the data object in sorted order, as opposed to sorting the Record cache in place (defaults to false).

config.name: sortInfo
config.desc: A config object in the format: {field: "fieldName", direction: "ASC|DESC"}

config.name: baseParams
config.desc:
An object containing properties which are to be sent as parameters
on any HTTP request

config.name: isLocal
config.desc:
flag if data is locally available (and can be always looked up
without a remote query - used by combo/forms at present.

methods.name: reload
methods.desc:
Reloads the Record cache from the configured Proxy using the configured Reader and
the options from the last load operation performed.

params.name: options
params.desc:
(optional) An object containing properties which may override the options
used in the last load operation. See {@link #load} for details (defaults to null, in which case
the most recently used options are reused).

methods.name: removeAll
methods.desc: Remove all Records from the Store and fires the clear event.

methods.name: query
methods.desc: Query the records by a specified property.

params.name: field
params.desc: A field on your records

params.name: value
params.desc:
Either a string that the field
should start with or a RegExp to test against the field

params.name: anyMatch
params.desc: True to match any part not just the beginning

returns.desc: Returns an Roo.util.MixedCollection of the matched records

methods.name: sum
methods.desc: Sums the value of property for each record between start and end and returns the result.

params.name: property
params.desc: A field on your records

params.name: start
params.desc: The record index to start at (defaults to 0)

params.name: end
params.desc: The last record index to include (defaults to length - 1)

methods.name: getById
methods.desc: Get the Record with the specified id.

params.name: id
params.desc: The id of the Record to find.

returns.desc: The Record with the passed id. Returns undefined if not found.

methods.name: commitChanges
methods.desc:
Commit all Records with outstanding changes. To handle updates for changes, subscribe to the
Store's "update" event, and perform updating when the third parameter is Roo.data.Record.COMMIT.

methods.name: getCount
methods.desc:
Gets the number of cached records.

If using paging, this may not be the total size of the dataset. If the data object used by the Reader contains the dataset size, then the getTotalCount() function returns the data set size

methods.name: indexOf
methods.desc: Get the index within the cache of the passed Record.

params.name: record
params.desc: The Roo.data.Record object to to find.

returns.desc: The index of the passed Record. Returns -1 if not found.

methods.name: add
methods.desc: Add Records to the Store and fires the add event.

params.name: records
params.desc: An Array of Roo.data.Record objects to add to the cache.

methods.name: indexOfId
methods.desc: Get the index within the cache of the Record with the passed id.

params.name: id
params.desc: The id of the Record to find.

returns.desc: The index of the Record. Returns -1 if not found.

methods.name: filter
methods.desc: Filter the records by a specified property.

params.name: field
params.desc: A field on your records

params.name: value
params.desc:
Either a string that the field
should start with or a RegExp to test against the field

params.name: anyMatch
params.desc: True to match any part not just the beginning

methods.name: sort
methods.desc:
Sort the Records.
If remote sorting is used, the sort is performed on the server, and the cache is
reloaded. If local sorting is used, the cache is sorted internally.

params.name: fieldName
params.desc: The name of the field to sort by.

params.name: dir
params.desc: (optional) The sort order, "ASC" or "DESC" (defaults to "ASC")

methods.name: getRange
methods.desc: Returns a range of Records between specified indices.

params.name: startIndex
params.desc: (optional) The starting index (defaults to 0)

params.name: endIndex
params.desc: (optional) The ending index (defaults to the last Record in the Store)

methods.name: queryBy
methods.desc:
Query by a function. The specified function will be called with each
record in this data source. If the function returns true the record is included
in the results.

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to be called, it will receive 2 args (record, id)

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to this)

returns.desc: Returns an Roo.util.MixedCollection of the matched records

methods.name: loadDataFromChildren
methods.desc: using 'cn' the nested child reader read the child array into it's child stores.

params.name: rec
params.desc: The record with a 'children array

methods.name: clearFilter
methods.desc: Revert to a view of the Record cache with no filtering applied.

params.name: suppressEvent
params.desc: If true the filter is cleared silently without notifying listeners

methods.name: each
methods.desc: Calls the specified function for each of the Records in the cache.

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to call. The Record is passed as the first parameter. Returning false aborts and exits the iteration.

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope in which to call the function (defaults to the Record).

methods.name: rejectChanges
methods.desc: Cancel outstanding changes on all changed records.

methods.name: getAt
methods.desc: Get the Record at the specified index.

params.name: index
params.desc: The index of the Record to find.

returns.desc: The Record at the passed index. Returns undefined if not found.

methods.name: getTotalCount
methods.desc:
Gets the total number of records in the dataset as returned by the server.

If using paging, for this to be accurate, the data object used by the Reader must contain the dataset size

methods.name: filterBy
methods.desc:
Filter by a function. The specified function will be called with each
record in this data source. If the function returns true the record is included,
otherwise it is filtered.

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to be called, it will receive 2 args (record, id)

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope of the function (defaults to this)

methods.name: collect
methods.desc: Collects unique values for a particular dataIndex from this store.

params.name: dataIndex
params.desc: The property to collect

params.name: allowNull
params.desc: (optional) Pass true to allow null, undefined or empty string values

params.name: bypassFilter
params.desc: (optional) Pass true to collect from all records, even ones which are filtered

returns.desc: An array of the unique values

methods.name: getModifiedRecords
methods.desc:
Gets all records modified since the last commit.  Modified records are persisted across load operations
(e.g., during paging).

returns.desc: An array of Records containing outstanding modifications.

methods.name: remove
methods.desc: Remove a Record from the Store and fires the remove event.

params.name: record
params.desc: The Roo.data.Record object to remove from the cache.

methods.name: loadData
methods.desc:
Loads data from a passed data block. A Reader which understands the format of the data
must have been configured in the constructor.

params.name: data
params.desc:
The data block from which to read the Records.  The format of the data expected
is dependent on the type of Reader that is configured and should correspond to that Reader's readRecords parameter.

params.name: append
params.desc: True to append the new Records rather than replace the existing cache.

methods.name: load
methods.desc:
Loads the Record cache from the configured Proxy using the configured Reader.

If using remote paging, then the first load call must specify the start and limit properties in the options.params property to establish the initial position within the dataset, and the number of Records to cache on each read from the Proxy.

It is important to note that for remote data sources, loading is asynchronous, and this call will return before the new data has been loaded. Perform any post-processing in a callback function, or in a "load" event handler.

params.name: options
params.desc:
An object containing properties which control loading options:
  • params {Object} An object containing properties to pass as HTTP parameters to a remote data source.
  • params.data {Object} if you are using a MemoryProxy / JsonReader, use this as the data to load stuff.. 
                    {
                    data : data,  // array of key=>value data like JsonReader
                    total : data.length,
                    success : true
                    
                }
    }.
  • callback {Function} A function to be called after the Records have been loaded. The callback is passed the following arguments:
    • r : Roo.data.Record[]
    • options: Options object from the load call
    • success: Boolean success indicator
  • scope {Object} Scope with which to call the callback (defaults to the Store object)
  • add {Boolean} indicator to append loaded records rather than replace the current cache.

methods.name: setDefaultSort
methods.desc: Sets the default sort column and order to be used by the next load operation.

params.name: fieldName
params.desc: The name of the field to sort by.

params.name: dir
params.desc: (optional) The sort order, "ASC" or "DESC" (defaults to "ASC")

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Inserts Records to the Store at the given index and fires the add event.

params.name: index
params.desc: The start index at which to insert the passed Records.

params.name: records
params.desc: An Array of Roo.data.Record objects to add to the cache.

methods.name: getSortState
methods.desc:
Returns the sort state of the Store as an object with two properties: 

 field {String} The name of the field by which the Records are sorted
 direction {String} The sort order, "ASC" or "DESC"

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional)

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

params.name: object
params.desc: The object with the events defined

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to release

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

params.name: args
params.desc: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

returns.desc: returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The name of the event to check for

returns.desc: True if the event is being listened for, else false

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to capture

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to call

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options

events.name: beforeloadadd
events.desc: Fires after a new set of Records has been loaded.

params.name: records
params.desc: The Records that were loaded

params.name: options
params.desc: The loading options that were specified (see {@link #load} for details)

events.name: loadexception
events.desc:
Fires if an exception occurs in the Proxy during loading.
Called with the signature of the Proxy's "loadexception" event.
If you return Json { data: [] , success: false, .... } then this will be thrown with the following args

params.name: ret
params.desc: return data from JsonData.reader() - success, totalRecords, records

params.name: opts
params.desc: - load Options

params.name: jsonData
params.desc: from your request (normally this contains the Exception)

events.name: load
events.desc: Fires after a new set of Records has been loaded, before they are added to the store.

params.name: records
params.desc: The Records that were loaded

params.name: options
params.desc: The loading options that were specified (see {@link #load} for details)

events.name: add
events.desc: Fires when Records have been added to the Store

params.name: records
params.desc: The array of Records added

params.name: index
params.desc: The index at which the record(s) were added

events.name: metachange
events.desc: Fires when this store's reader provides new metadata (fields). This is currently only support for JsonReaders.

params.name: meta
params.desc: The JSON metadata

events.name: clear
events.desc: Fires when the data cache has been cleared.

events.name: remove
events.desc: Fires when a Record has been removed from the Store

params.name: record
params.desc: The Record that was removed

params.name: index
params.desc: The index at which the record was removed

events.name: update
events.desc: Fires when a Record has been updated

params.name: record
params.desc: The Record that was updated

params.name: operation
params.desc:
The update operation being performed. Value may be one of: 

 Roo.data.Record.EDIT
 Roo.data.Record.REJECT
 Roo.data.Record.COMMIT

events.name: beforeload
events.desc:
Fires before a request is made for a new data object.  If the beforeload handler returns false
the load action will be canceled.

params.name: options
params.desc: The loading options that were specified (see {@link #load} for details)

events.name: datachanged
events.desc:
Fires when the data cache has changed, and a widget which is using this Store
as a Record cache should refresh its view.
